com.datumbox.framework.machinelearning.topicmodeling

Class LatentDirichletAllocation.ModelParameters

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.datumbox.framework.machinelearning.common.bases.baseobjects.BaseModelParameters

          • com.datumbox.framework.machinelearning.topicmodeling.LatentDirichletAllocation.ModelParameters
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Learnable, Serializable
    Enclosing class:
    LatentDirichletAllocation

    public static class LatentDirichletAllocation.ModelParameters
extends BaseMLtopicmodeler.ModelParameters
    The ModelParameters class stores the coefficients that were learned during the training of the algorithm.

      • getTopicAssignmentOfDocumentWord

        public Map<List<Object>,Integer> getTopicAssignmentOfDocumentWord()
        Getter for the Topic Assignments of the words of the document. It returns the topic assignments of a particular word in a particular document. It is a key-value of [<Integer>, <Object>] => Integer The key is a combination of Record.id and Word Position number (also an Integer but stored as object because the Record stores columns as Objects). The value is the Id of the topic to which the word is assigned.
        Returns:

      • setTopicAssignmentOfDocumentWord

        protected void setTopicAssignmentOfDocumentWord(Map<List<Object>,Integer> topicAssignmentOfDocumentWord)
        Setter for the Topic Assignments of the words of the document.
        Parameters:
        topicAssignmentOfDocumentWord -

      • getDocumentTopicCounts

        public Map<List<Integer>,Integer> getDocumentTopicCounts()
        Getter for the Document's Topic counts. It contains counts the number of occurrences of topics in a particular document (in other words the number of times that a word from the particular document has been assigned to a particular topic). It is a key value of [<Integer>, <Integer>] => Integer The key is a combination of Record.id and Topic id. The value is the number of counts of the pair.
        Returns:

      • setDocumentTopicCounts

        protected void setDocumentTopicCounts(Map<List<Integer>,Integer> documentTopicCounts)
        setter for the Document's Topic counts.
        Parameters:
        documentTopicCounts -

      • getTopicWordCounts

        public Map<List<Object>,Integer> getTopicWordCounts()
        Getter for the topic-word counts. It counts the number of times a particular word is assigned to a particular topic. It is a key value of [<Integer>, <Object>] => Integer The key is a combination of Topic id and Record Value which should normally be a String (the word) but is stored in the associative array of the record as an Object. The value is the number of counts of the pair.
        Returns:

      • setTopicWordCounts

        protected void setTopicWordCounts(Map<List<Object>,Integer> topicWordCounts)
        Setter for the topic-word counts.
        Parameters:
        topicWordCounts -

      • getDocumentWordCounts

        public Map<Integer,Integer> getDocumentWordCounts()
        Getter for the number of words in each document. Even though this information is available to us from Record.size(), we store this info to be able to compute the probability of θ without having access on the original Record. It is a key value of Integer => Integer The key is the Record.Id. The Value is the number of counts.
        Returns:

      • setDocumentWordCounts

        protected void setDocumentWordCounts(Map<Integer,Integer> documentWordCounts)
        Setter for the number of words in each document.
        Parameters:
        documentWordCounts -

      • getTopicCounts

        public Map<Integer,Integer> getTopicCounts()
        Getter for the number of words assigned to the particular topic. It is a key value of Integer => Integer The key the Topic Id. The Value is the number of counts.
        Returns:

      • setTopicCounts

        protected void setTopicCounts(Map<Integer,Integer> topicCounts)
        Setter for the number of words assigned to the particular topic.
        Parameters:
        topicCounts -
